commentary: Based on an old Punjabi folk tale - of a supposed far away King of Baghdad, King Dahood.
The story goes that through the intrigues of his relatives, young Dahood and his mother, Queen Hansa, are exiled.
Losing their kingdom, they live in poverty - young Dahood forgetting his throne completely.
As a child, Dahood befriends a princess, and they bond over time.
The king arranges the marriage of the princess to a foreign king.
The princess laments to Dahood - reminding him of his past, trying to reawaken the desire of the throne in him.
